title: VELVEETAÂ® Skillet Dinners - Tuna
summary: VELVEETAÂ® Skillet Dinners - Tuna might be just the main course you are searching for. For 58 cents per serving, this recipe covers 14% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One portion of this dish contains about 16g of protein, 10g of fat, and a total of 343 calories. This recipe serves 5. This recipe from Kraft Recipes has 1 fans. A mixture of knudsen cream, velveetaâ, peas, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so yummy. To use up the peas you could follow this main course with the Easy Peasy Strawberry Dessert as a dessert. It is a good option if you're following a pescatarian diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 30 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 64%. This score is solid. Try VELVEETAÂ® Sausage Skillet, VELVEETAÂ® Shepherd's Pie Skillet, and VELVEETAÂ® Tuna & Noodles for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Merlot, Pinot Noir, and rosé Wine are my top picks for Tuna. Though fish is often paired with white wine, 'meatier' fish like tuna can absolutely go with red wine. A Rosé will also pair nicely, particularly if your tunan is prepared with ingredients better suited to a white wine. One wine you could try is Enate Cabernet Sauvignon Merlot. It has 4.8 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 19 dollars.

productMatches.title: Enate Cabernet Sauvignon Merlot
productMatches.description: Fully ruby color. A complex blackcurrant, blackberry aroma with a touch of violet and hints of red pepper, vanilla and herbs. Smooth and round mouthfeel; the soft tannic cushion gives way to a flavorsome palate which releases pleasant honey-roast aromas. The well-balanced acidity will ensure improvement in the bottle over the next five years.

instructions: Bring 2 cups water to boil in large nonstick skillet.  Stir in pasta.  Reduce heat to medium; cover skillet with tight-fitting lid.  Simmer 10 to 15 minutes or until pasta is tender and just a little water remains in the skillet.                                            Stir in VELVEETA, tuna and peas. Cook until VELVEETA is completely melted, stirring frequently.  Remove from heat.  Stir in sour cream.

steps.step: Bring 2 cups water to boil in large nonstick skillet.  Stir in pasta.  Reduce heat to medium; cover skillet with tight-fitting lid.  Simmer 10 to 15 minutes or until pasta is tender and just a little water remains in the skillet.
Stir in VELVEETA, tuna and peas. Cook until VELVEETA is completely melted, stirring frequently.
Remove from heat.  Stir in sour cream.
